website_summaries.verdict: The Acer Iconia W4-820-2466 is a bright, compact 8-inch Windows 8 slate tablet. With a full copy of Microsoft Office Home and Student and almost 10 hours of battery life, it's a viable alternative to carrying an ultraportable laptop to class or meetings.
pros: Includes Microsoft Office Home and Student

customer_reviews.title: great tablet, great ACER, WINDOS 8.1 not the best choise
customer_reviews.text: I had an ACER ICONIA TAB A100, and I love it until the screan breaks, so I bought a replacement and I tought that this was a good alternative. However, the tablet it self is great, the problem that I have is with Windows 8.1 on a really small screan, then it is difficult to use it and there are very small apps that you can use, it is not like Android that there are apps for everything. Thenit is unfair to give 3 starts to the tablet because it is a great machine, I am giving 3 starts for the mix of tablet and software
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: good product, not the best but...
customer_reviews.text: Great autonomy, nice screen, lightweight and runs windows 8.1 smoothly, office student edition is a cool add-on, an average camera and charge with any high power USB charger Less than 8gb for your personal files (I have the 32gb version, you can solve this getting an SD card), windows button is not responsive sometimes, mediocre audio, HDMI is not completely functional: not full HDMI output, not working with regular HDMI to VGA converters (need external power for it), USB 2.0 only. Anyway, I consider it has a good performance/price ratio
customer_reviews.author: Hugo Carrillo

customer_reviews.title: Works well, carry it almost everywhere.
customer_reviews.text: Love the tablet. Occasional hiccups, but not more than any other devices I use. The micro hdmi out is great. The only complaints I have is no usb and charge at the same time, and I wish it had a digitized pen. As far as competitors go, most of the 8 inch windows tablets are very similar. If you want the micro hdmi out buy this one. If you want a digitized pen, look elsewhere. I love this device and would absolutely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: natemulli

customer_reviews.title: Great Win8 Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I love the tablet, it is quick and has a full version of windows on it which is very nice. I wish the resolution was higher but Windows 8 makes great use of the smaller screen and resolution. Acer does include some crapware but it is so easy to remove that its barely worth mentioning. Tablet also has pretty good sound and the IPS display is easy to read, even in the sunlight.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: and it's a bit smaller but I really love it. The only difference is it's easier to ...
customer_reviews.text: I have an ipad as well as this tablet, and it's a bit smaller but I really love it. The only difference is it's easier to use a stylus with this than your finger tip because it seems to be more sensitive than an ipad. If you like or want to learn to use windows 8, this is a great device to have. It's small enough to fit in post handbags and not a chore to carry around. :)
customer_reviews.author: CupCup

customer_reviews.title: Better than the Dell and Toshiba tablets
customer_reviews.text: I love this tablet, I went from a dual core laptop to this W4 tablet. Its faster, portable and convenient to take away from home, then my laptop. Once I received it, I updated all Windows updates, and Acer updates. So far so good. Froze one time, but I had Windows updating tons of updates at once. Pros - Micro HDMI port (mirroring on Hd TV). IPS screen. Windows 8.1 full installed (not RT). Microsoft office included. Cons - battery life, about 6-8 hours (depending on what I'm doing). OTG micro USB wasn't included in new box.(as pervious models) 4.5 out of 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Felizardo

customer_reviews.title: yuck
customer_reviews.text: doesn't hold a charge over night, and freezes frequently. i haven't picked it up in months because i have to reset it by sticking a pin into a hole to get to the reset button. Even then it will only work for so long before it freezes again. Could just be a bad one of the bunch but i'm still displeased. i think a fire tablet would have been a better choice for myself, but i digress.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: A good little machine
customer_reviews.text: I have a Windows Surface Pro 2, a Kindle Fire, and an iPad. This Acer Iconia is a welcome addition. It's lightweight, easy to hold when I use it as an e-reader. It's fast and powerful. I am able to check work email and use the MS Office suite easily on this small form factor. For Windows users, this is a great tablet to have.
customer_reviews.author: M Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet
customer_reviews.text: A very nice little tablet. Lots of features like the mini HDMI. Highly rated by a leading Consumer magazine. The screen isn't as vivid as an iPad Mini but still very nice.... at about half the price. The average rating for the iPad Mini was 82 and 80 for the Acer. Setup was extremely quick and easy as it had the option to sync settings with our existing Windows 8 laptop. And of course, it has Office. Nice!
customer_reviews.author: Iboughtthis

customer_reviews.title: Still kicking after a few months
customer_reviews.text: Great tablet for the price. I have been using it for a few months. The only issue that I have, is that tablets of this size don't come with additional USB ports besides the charging port. I am not marking off for this because none of the 8" tablets have this.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Just a great little Tablet super value for money
customer_reviews.text: Just a great little Tablet super value for money. Win 8.1 still a little confusing but it's improving all the time. I operate the Tablet with keyboard and mouse both work well via the Bluetooth interface. Love the HDMI interface. So far I am satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Burningham

customer_reviews.title: Nice price
customer_reviews.text: I love the tablet does a lot of things that I want. I have one problem with it, it's windows 8.1 but it has SKYDRIVE should be ONEDRIVE ? . I have all my pictures on Onedrive and I can't get them it keeps saying to update I tried then it says soon???
customer_reviews.author: pete

customer_reviews.title: What a waste of time and money!!!
customer_reviews.text: Did not work our from the box. Went to all the troubles of the support page, calle customer service, gave it to a technician to see if he could make it work, nothing.... it's in the recycling bin. What a waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Ignacio Zuloaga

customer_reviews.title: substandard components, industry worst customer care.
customer_reviews.text: 3 months after ownership the touch screen quit responding just as it got out of warranty, I haven't been able to get the device to work since. I contacted Acer and they won't do anything about it other than I will have to pay for the replacement, since it's not covered on the warranty, very disappointed about that. However until that happened I was very happy with every single feature on v this device and if I wasn't worried about getting another faulty device I'd get another one.
customer_reviews.author: omnomnomivore

customer_reviews.title: Good small pc
customer_reviews.text: It is a real pity that it does not have a charging port. Charging through the micro usb limits the working possibilities.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar B

customer_reviews.title: Has some really good points but is "quirky"
customer_reviews.text: Has some really good points but is "quirky". Overall I'm happy but sometimes feeling there could be so much more. For the price it's a great value.
customer_reviews.author: C. Jay Pees

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tablet
customer_reviews.text: Best full windows tablet for the price. If you dont have a lot of money to spend and want full windows 8, this is the one to get. Another plus is the inclusion of microsoft office home & student for free.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. I was looking for something to test ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. I was looking for something to test replacing my laptop with a tablet. This is performing well and is all of the investment I wanted to make to test the waters. Enjoying it!
customer_reviews.author: Scott B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I use this more like a netbook. But if you did want to do work you but would probably want to hook to TV. Win 8 has taken very little to get used to. Listening to all the complaints I thought it would be very hard but all it is win 7 with a tablet friendly metro on other side. I see the complaints coming from desktop users. Back to w4. Very good build. Hdmi is a must on one of these 8 inch tablets. Runs fast enough for me, mostly web, music and video. App store needs help. Games.... well that's what my nexus 10 is for. Screen gets very bright. Worth 300.00 dollars? Hell yes!
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Good value and does everything I expect of it. I would recommend it for anyone who wants or needs a tablet that can handle Windows.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reboots for no reason, hardware failure
customer_reviews.text: The tablet was nice until it had a hardware failure after just a few months. It just started spontaneously rebooting for no reason after anywhere from 10 minutes to 2 hours of use, at random. I have tried many troubleshooting steps and it still spontaneously reboots itself even when just sitting there doing nothing. This is apparently a common enough problem that I was able to easily find other people reporting the same problem with a simple google search. If you get this tablet, get it from a store that will accept returns or will replace it if this happens to you. If it hadn't failed like this, I would be really enjoying this tablet. As it is, it's unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Flensr

customer_reviews.title: I have had nothing but trouble with my tablet. ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had nothing but trouble with my tablet. First the battery fried. I sent it back and it was repaired under warranty. However now the warranty has expired and the network adapter has stopped working. I can't find anywhere to get it fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Marion E. Dickson

customer_reviews.title: but that is the only issue I've had with it in like six months
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes it doesn't restart properly and you need to hold the power button down for forever, but that is the only issue I've had with it in like six months. It's great!
customer_reviews.author: Elle W.

customer_reviews.title: Nice tablet overall
customer_reviews.text: Nice tablet overall. The interface is not intuitive. The touch registration seems to be a tiny bit off. No problems with OS - it is not constantly asking me to update like the mobile android OS. Online store leaves much to be desired.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Owens

customer_reviews.title: Most expensive paperweight i own
customer_reviews.text: Most expensive paperweight I own!!! It has been many months now since I have owned this. What a surprise its garbage and ii don't even bother to pick it up anymore. Only the desktop version works for me now, the updates are horrendous and seriously why cant you hook it up to your tv to watch movies off of it. I had to download a mouse app. Just complete uselessness. I bought it for work and really its left me high and dry. I don't recommend this anyone, I too have had to do numerous reboots with no luck.
customer_reviews.author: Lil Consumer

customer_reviews.title: fast fast fast.
customer_reviews.text: One fast computer... its on 5g wi fi. I down loaded a 1.5 gig movie in 8 mins Fast .. the screen is clean clear ..VLC works better than ever ... its everything the w3 should have been... this computer is far more than anything I have owned.. the hdmi is different.. you must go through devices... you can watch a movie in your TV. plus surf the web.. download. one fast computer Ask me anything. I'll answer Sal
customer_reviews.author: Sal' d

customer_reviews.title: This is a great tablet. i have an acer laptop that i ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tablet. i have an acer laptop that i love and this is the first tablet i've bought. So far this thing is awesome!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Larimer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: a great investment I made,love it for playing games and surfing the web...even playing music is soooooo clear.
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Absolute love it. Its like having a mini laptop in my purse where ever I go.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Sherwin

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love it. The only thing that keeps this unit from reeceiving 5 stars is its propensity to drop the internet when not in use. Exchanged the first unit with another - same result. Its a minor nuisance - not a deal breaker. All windows programs I have installed - including EOS Utility - a camera interface - work flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: i.candide

customer_reviews.title: Avoid! The Tech Support (or lack of it) helps kill it
customer_reviews.text: AVOID. I bought mine because Consumer Reports rated it highly, and I've owned 5 Acer products previously. First, I couldn't activate Windows on the device. I called Microsoft but couldn't provide a product key. Because Acer, in its infinite wisdom, put that key on the MOTHERBOARD. Then I reached Acer via chat (which is in India and is not 24/7) and they said I'd have to call back during the 7-hour window when their senior tech support works. (Must be nice.) So bottom line: the tech support is just bad enough to completely cancel out any benefit to owning an Acer product. My loyalty to this brand is so done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice tablet
customer_reviews.text: Nice tablet, great screen. It does NOT have the ability to charge AND have something else USB plugged in at the same time. Pity. It could have served as a desktop replacement by using a docking station/port replicator. Perhaps someone will come up with a way to overcome this limitation. It does work with a dock/port replicator. Battery life is quite good, it last for about 8 hours of normal use.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Broucinek

customer_reviews.title: Not a good experience
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 of these. One 32gb and one 64gb. I had to send both in for Warranty service within the first week. Repairs were successfully completed, but I had to wait over two weeks for them to return the item to me. Not a very good track record for two brand new tablets.
customer_reviews.author: Leighton Markley

customer_reviews.title: I Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Battery life sucks on standby but the tablet is awesome for having a full Windows experience in the palm of your hand
customer_reviews.author: Josh H.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. Love the quality of the tablets
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Love the quality of the tablets. The only down side is that I cannot find a fine point stylus to accompany it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Got Battery Life?
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is something to be desired for. If I had to buy again most likely not.
customer_reviews.author: C5Driver

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Travel Solution
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I needed for travel. The limitation on most tablets was the ability to do Powerpoint presentations. This has the software, the power, storage capacity and the ports to do exactly what I need.
customer_reviews.author: PromoPower Consignment

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: works great I have had it for just over a month and use it every day battery life seems pretty good would recommend it to a friend
customer_reviews.author: Cleve kitchens

customer_reviews.title: Good tablet.
customer_reviews.text: Great tablet. Really happy with the full version of windows. Only downside is sometimes clicking on items is tough because everything is small. You have to zoom in sometimes to click a link. Would like to see a keyboard for this. I also wish that when you click on a text box example a Browser box it should automatically bring up a keyboard but doesnt. Screen resolution is fantastic. Camera isnt great but not really a necessity it has trouble with light differences. Otherwise for basic computing, browsing, etc its great. Battery life seems pretty good just make sure to shut it down after use or it will be dead the following day when you try to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Waller

customer_reviews.title: More or less ok
customer_reviews.text: It freeses, it works, the touch is so so ...
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good windows tablet for the price as long as ...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good windows tablet for the price as long as you don't expect too much. Good battery life, decent screen.
customer_reviews.author: Picky Consumer

customer_reviews.title: nice tablet
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. We have had it for a month. It comes in handy to keep others off of my computers. Let them fill this up with the strange downloads that come with all those online games. I will come back and update this review if they manage to crash it or bog it down. As I said, nice tablet - I am a hint envious and if this continues to work out well - I may come out of the dark ages and get one of these for myself :-)

customer_reviews.title: The tablet was more than I hoped for!
customer_reviews.text: At maximum brightness, my battery was decreasing by one percent in 3-5 minute intervals. This was already while I was browsing or watching video files, while downloading torrents. Needless to say, battery life is superb! Also, it truly is a remarkable replacement for my laptop. I bring it to the office everyday!
customer_reviews.author: Darren T.

customer_reviews.title: The precision of the pen could be better, and the lack of HDMI does remind of ...
customer_reviews.text: The precision of the pen could be better, and the lack of HDMI does remind of itself when you most need it, but for the price it is a solid device I am happy with. Best for note taking with OneNote.
customer_reviews.author: Snakiest

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like the quality of the hardware and the software is faulty.
customer_reviews.author: José

customer_reviews.title: I hate Apple and didn't realize that Windows isn't in the ...
customer_reviews.text: This tablet barely works. I wouldn't have bought it but for my ignorance of what to look for in a tablet. I hate Apple and didn't realize that Windows isn't in the app business. It sounds like tablets aren't even moving forward but for the iPads.
customer_reviews.author: John Braden

customer_reviews.title: To give praise
customer_reviews.text: Not used,The memory of some small,but it looks so good.To give praise。 Acer Iconia W4-820-2894 8-Inch 32 GB Windows Tablet (Smokey Gray),
customer_reviews.author: zhancih

customer_reviews.title: touch pad does not respond well
customer_reviews.text: i use g mail and the tablet does not work right with it paying what i did for that i expected better quailty not very happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Richard cousins

customer_reviews.title: Jokeus Maximus
customer_reviews.text: Since I cant think of anything good to say, I won't say anything.
customer_reviews.author: Yea I Bought It

customer_reviews.title: Acer disappointed me
customer_reviews.text: quality of the tablet is under average level. 1. there is a bubble on the back of tablet, under the skin. 2. the screen flickers two or three times irregularly. too lazy to exchange for a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Ning X.

product_meta.title: Acer Iconia W4-820-2894 8-Inch 32 GB Windows Tablet (Smokey Gray)
product_meta.description:
Acer Iconia W4-820-2894 Tablet comes with these high level Specs: Intel Atom Quad-Core Processor Z3740, Windows 8.1, 8" HD 1280 x 800 resolution high-brightness (300-nit) Acer CrystalBrite LED-backlit IPS LCD Display, 5-Point multi-touch screen, supporting finger touch and image auto rotation, Intel HD Graphics with 64MB of dedicated system memory, High-definition audio support, 2048MB of LPDDR3 Onboard memory, 32GB Internal Storage, MicroSD memory slot up to 64GB, 802.11a/b/g/n Wireless, Bluetooth 4.0, 5MP Rear-facing camera, 2MP Front-facing camera, 1 - Micro USB 2.0 Port, 1 - Micro-HDMI with HDCP support, 2-Cell Li-Ion (4960 mAh) Battery, Up to 8-hours Battery Life, .91 lbs. 0.415 kg (tablet only), Microsoft Office Home and Student 2013 (activation code included)

AMAZON.COM
feature_bullets: Intel Atom Quad-Core Z3740 1.33 GHz Processor
32 GB Flash Memory, 2 GB RAM Memory

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.4 out of 5 stars109 ratings3.4 out of 5 stars
